intro: Uncinia tenella, commonly known as the slender hookweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, hooked fruits that aid in seed dispersal. Uncinia tenella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
